greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = n-th integer from among those positive integers which are coprime to n(n+1)/2.
link: Robert Israel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
example: The positive integers which are coprime to (5*6/2)=15 are 1,2,4,7,8,11,13,14... The fifth of these integers is 8, so a(5) = 8.
maple: if igcd(k,t)=1 then count:= count+1; if count = n then return k fi fi
mathematica: f[n_] := Block[{k = 0, c = n},While[c > 0,k++;While[GCD[n*(n + 1)/2, k] > 1, k++ ];c--;];k];Table[f[n], {n, 65}] (* _Ray Chandler_, Nov 10 2006 *)
results.author: _Leroy Quet_, Nov 08 2006
